basics.name: Xinhe Gao
basics.label: Student Scientist
basics.summary: B.Eng in Biomedical Engineering interested in computational and cognitive neuroscience.

work.name: Gouki Okazawa Lab, Chinese Academy of Sciences
work.summary: Building macaque decision-making tasks and datasets to study the neural mechanisms of perceptual decision making.
highlights: Design multi-task perceptual decision-making paradigms within the Remote-controlled Object-oriented MATLAB-based Experiments (ROME) system.
Train macaque monkeys on perceptual decision-making tasks and collect behavioral and neural data.
Develop an in-cage training system to improve task engagement and learning speed compared with traditional in-rig setups.

work.name: Center for Brain-like Computing and Machine Intelligence, Shanghai Jiao Tong University
work.summary: Developing deep learning models for EEG-based emotion recognition with a focus on mixture-of-experts methods and subject-specific adaptation.
highlights: Implemented a prompt-based Mixture-of-Experts (pMoE) classifier in PyTorch for EEG emotion recognition.
Benchmarked the pMoE model against classic baselines on SEED datasets, achieving substantial accuracy gains across multiple emotion-state settings.
Second author on a manuscript under review at ICASSP 2026.

work.name: NABME Lab, School of Biomedical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University
work.summary: Wet-lab work on a personalized nucleic acid diagnostics project for cancer.
highlights: Performed DNA extraction and library preparation from tissue samples using phi29 polymerase amplification, nested PCR, qPCR, and magnetic bead purification.
Contributed to a precision diagnostics workflow for endometrial cancer.
Team project won 3rd Prize in the National Biomedical Engineering Innovation Design Competition.

publications.name: pMoE: A prompt-based Mixture of Experts model for unified and incremental emotion recognition
publications.summary: Second-author manuscript under review at ICASSP 2026, proposing a prompt-based Mixture-of-Experts model that leverages subject-related information for unified and incremental EEG-based emotion recognition across multiple datasets.

events.summary: Active participation in international summer schools and training programs in neuroscience and neural engineering.
highlights: Attended the Sixth IEEE EMBS International Summer School of Neural Engineering, engaging in lectures and discussions on neural engineering and brain–computer interfaces.
Completed the Innovative Talents Science Training Program course “Principles of Brain Imaging and Modulation” taught by Prof. Chunlei Liu (UC Berkeley).
Presented and discussed neuroscience-related topics in journal clubs and seminars.

skills.name: Experimental Skills

projects.name: Neural Activity Prediction
projects.summary: Explored task-driven, data-driven, and hybrid models for predicting inferior temporal cortex responses, focusing on how network architecture impacts population-level stability.
highlights: Compared multiple model classes on neural prediction tasks.
Investigated how hybrid approaches improve stability by reducing cross-neuron variability.

projects.name: Neuromechanical Zebrafish Modeling
projects.summary: Tested neuromechanical hypotheses of zebrafish locomotion using coupled central pattern generators, proprioceptive feedback, and hydrodynamic drag models in simulation.
highlights: Implemented and evaluated neuromechanical models of locomotion.
Gained experience with computational motor control and closed-loop simulations.

projects.name: Brain Vascular MRI Image Segmentation
projects.summary: Constructed a population-level brain vascular atlas from MRI using a hybrid traditional plus deep-learning segmentation pipeline.
highlights: Segmented vasculature across multiple datasets and registered them into a common space.
Evaluated atlas quality with Dice similarity metrics and literature comparisons.
